metadata.title: "The Boy from Itúkuk"
metadata.author: Nettie Reuben
metadata.publication: William Bright, The Karok Language (1957), pp. 262-267, Text 57

s.txt: uknîi .
s.trans: Once upon a time--
s.note: This sentence is missing a period in the Karuk in the published text, which may be on purpose owing to uknîi not being a full sentence. However, I put a period here to follow our convention.

s.txt:
uum
vúra
káan
u 'iifshípree nik
afíshnihanich ,
itúkuk .
s.trans: A young man lived there at itúkuk (in Yurok territory, opposite Weitchpec).

s.txt:
uum
vúra
itíhaan
kuma máh'iit
t óo
kvátar ,
itukuk 'afishríhan .
s.trans: The young man of itúkuk went gathering sweathouse wood every morning.

s.txt:
xás
ithâan
kuma máh'iit
u xus , "
ithyáruk
kan vâaram i .
s.trans: And one morning he thought, "Let me go across-river!

s.txt:
patapriha 'asiktávaan
kan imúsan ."
s.trans: Let me go see the woman at patapríhak (a part of Weitchpec?)!"

s.txt:
xás
u víitkar .
s.trans: So he rowed across.

s.txt:
u 'uum ,
pa kun 'íin irak .
s.trans: He arrived where they lived.

s.txt:
víri
kún
pa kéevniikich
ú krii ,
káru
patapriha 'ifápiit .
s.trans: There lived the old woman, and the young woman of patapríhak.

s.txt:
xás
u chuphuníshkoo ,
pa 'ifápiit .
s.trans: Then he talked to the young woman.

s.txt:
xás
vúra
tá
kun vîiha ,
pa keevnikich 'íin .
s.trans: But the old woman disliked him.

s.txt:
xás
ú pkaar .
s.trans: So he came back across.

s.txt:
imáankam
kuma máh'iit
kúkuum
vúra
u kvátar .
s.trans: The next morning he rowed across again.

s.txt:
xás
u xus , "
tîi
ithyáruk
kan p imúsan
pa 'ifápiit ."
s.trans: He thought, "Let me go across to see the girl again!"

s.txt:
xás
kúkuum
vúra
u chuphuníshkoo .
s.trans: And he talked to her again.

s.txt:
vúra
tá
kun vîiha ,
pa keevnikich 'íin .
s.trans: The old woman disliked him.

s.txt:
kúkuum
vúra
ú pkaar .
s.trans: He came back across.

s.txt:
xás
u xus , "
hôoy
áta
kun iyaarám oo tih ,
pa t óo
kxurarah aak ."
s.trans: And he thought, "I wonder where they always go when evening comes?"

s.txt:
xás
u xus , "
tîi
kan imúsan ."
s.trans: And he thought, "Let me go see!"

s.txt:
xás
u víitkar ,
kúkuum .
s.trans: So he rowed across again.

s.txt:
xás
p óo 'uum ,
chanchaaksúr ak
u tnûupnih .
s.trans: And when he arrived, he looked in through the smokehole.

s.txt:
xás
kun p ikyáasiiprina tih .
s.trans: They were getting ready (to go).

s.txt:
pa mukun 'átimnam
tá
axyará va .
s.trans: Their burden baskets were all full.

s.txt:
xás
chanchaaksúr ak
kun ishkurúhruuprih va ,
pa mukun 'átimnam .
s.trans: Then they pulled their burden baskets up through the smokehole.

s.txt:
xás
kun p ativ á siiprin ,
xás
kun iyâaram .
s.trans: And they put them on their backs, and they went off.
s.note: I am not sure about the morphological decomposition of kunpativásiiprin; need to check the accent.

s.txt:
vúrava
kun 'áhoo tih .
s.trans: They were walking that way.

s.txt:
yíiv
vúra
tá
kun 'uum .
s.trans: They went a long ways.

s.txt:
vúrava
u 'áharamu naa tih .
s.trans: He was following them that way.

s.txt:
xás
yúruk
u trûupu tih .
s.trans: Then he looked downriver.

s.txt:
vúra
taay
pá paa
tá
kun vitíshriih va .
s.trans: A lot of boats were beached.
s.note: Despite the translation having the boats as the subject, the verb kunvitíshriihva cannot be essive with the -va allomorph of the essive, because only the plural action -va would cause the vowel lengthening visible in riih.

s.txt:
xás
ú muus tih .
s.trans: And he looked at them.

s.txt:
"
hûut
áta
pá kun kuph eesh ."
s.trans: "I wonder what they're going to do?"

s.txt:
tá
kun sán aamnih va ,
pa mukún 'uup .
s.trans: They put their possessions in (the boats).

s.txt:
xás
yáas
kun vitshúr oo tih .
s.trans: And then they rowed away.

s.txt:
yúruk
tá
kun 'áchak rup ,
pa tá
kun vítrup oo .
s.trans: They rowed downriver in a bunch, when they rowed downriver.

s.txt:
itahanatápasich
pa mukún paah .
s.trans: They had a whole lot of boats.

s.txt:
xás
u xus , "
tîi
kan p ikvátan
pa naní paah ."
s.trans: And he thought, "Let me go get my boat!"

s.txt:
xás
vúra
uum
nîinamich
pa mú paah .
s.trans: His boat was just small.

s.txt:
"
xasík
ni 'áharamu naa vish ."
s.trans: "Then I'll follow them."
s.note: In the published text xasik is missing the acute accent, but it is also missing the dot above the i that would be there if there was no accent; this makes me think it is a printing error and because the acute accent is expected there I have written it.

s.txt:
xás
u p ikvíriproov .
s.trans: So he ran back upriver.

s.txt:
pa mú paa
ú kvaatfak .
s.trans: He brought his boat down from uphill.

s.txt:
ishkêesh ak
u thiivkúrih .
s.trans: He put it in the river.

s.txt:
kári
xás
u víitshur .
s.trans: He rowed away.

s.txt:
yúruk
u trûupu tih .
s.trans: He looked downriver.

s.txt:
vúrava
kun 'áchak rupu tih ,
pa mukún paah .
s.trans: Their boats were floating in a bunch like that.

s.txt:
xás
vúra
yíiv
t u víitma .
s.trans: And he rowed a long ways.

s.txt:
yúruk
u trûupu tih .
s.trans: He looked downriver.

s.txt:
káan
kun 'áchaku tih .
s.trans: They were floating in a bunch there.

s.txt:
xás
u trûupu tih ,
ú muus tih .
s.trans: And he looked downriver.

s.txt:
vúra
xára
tá
kun 'áchaku tih .
s.trans: They floated in a bunch for a long time.

s.txt:
axmáy
xás
vúra
pa 'íshaha
u chánchaaksur .
s.trans: Suddenly the water opened up.

s.txt:
xás
kun vítruuprih va ,
pá paah .
s.trans: Then they paddled the boats through.

s.txt:
xás
koovúra
tá
kun vítruuprih va ,
itahanatápasich
pá paah .
s.trans: And they paddled the whole lot of boats through.

s.txt:
xás
u p sívshap .
s.trans: Then (the water) closed up.
s.note: The river seems to have been blocked by a wall of water, which opened and closed at intervals.

s.txt:
xás
u viitvárak .
s.trans: So he paddled down from upstream.

s.txt:
t u p ithríishrih ,
pa 'íshaha .
s.trans: The water was filling in again.

s.txt:
xás
xanahíchyav
t óo
krûuntih .
s.trans: So he waited a good while.

s.txt:
xás
u chánchaaksur .
s.trans: Then it opened up.

s.txt:
xás
u viitrúprih .
s.trans: Then it opened up.

s.txt:
vúra
uum
nîinamich
pa mú paah .
s.trans: His boat was just little.

s.txt:
yíthukam
xás
u viitrúprih .
s.trans: He paddled through to the other side.

s.txt:
vúrava
u víitrup ,
yíiv
vúra
t u víitma .
s.trans: He paddled downriver like that, he paddled a long ways.

s.txt:
xás
u trûupu tih .
s.trans: Then he looked downriver.

s.txt:
yúruk
pá paah
tá
kun vitíshriih v aheen .
s.trans: Downriver they had beached the boats.
s.note: The length dot is missing from next to the i in kunvítishriihvaheen, but there is a space there so it appears to be just a printing error. If it was not long, the -va would have to be the essive, but the translation does not indicate this and because it is possible for the ii to be long, I have linked -va to plural action.

s.txt:
vúra
vaa
u víitrup .
s.trans: He paddled downriver like that.

s.txt:
xás
u vítish .
s.trans: Then he beached his boat.

s.txt:
xás
pa mú paa
u p íkvaatsip ,
kufípn iich
xás
u thárish .
s.trans: And he picked up his boat, and put it down in a willow grove.
s.note: kufípniich is a contracted form of kufípnihich, diminutive of kufiprih. See section 614.7 in Bright for mention of this contraction.

s.txt:
u xus , "
xáy
kun mah ."
s.trans: He thought, "Let them not see it!"

s.txt:
xás
máruk
ú kfuukraa .
s.trans: Then he climbed uphill.

s.txt:
pa vúra
kóo
kuma 'íthivishrih ,
pa kun vuhvúhi naa tih ,
káru
pa koo .
s.trans: There was all kind of celebration as they did the deerskin dance and all.

s.txt:
xás
máruk
ú kfuukraa .
s.trans: And he climbed uphill.

s.txt:
yee !
víri
kún
káan
xás
kun 'iin ,
pa kéevniikich
káru
pa 'ifápiit .
s.trans: Well, there they were, the old woman and the girl.

s.txt:
patapriha 'ifápiit
káan
xás
ú krii .
s.trans: The patapríhak girl was there.

s.txt:
xás
kun ipéer , "
chími
pásas ."
s.trans: And she told him, "Dress up (in dance regalia)!"

s.txt:
xás
u piip , "
pûu ,
naa
vúra
kâanimich .
s.trans: And he said, "No, I'm poor.
s.note: puu is written in Bright with a rising accent, but we write that in the modern orthography with the falling circumflex accent.

s.txt:
hôoy
íf
ni pásas eesh ."
s.trans: I can't dress up.

s.txt:
xás
kun ipéer , "
vúra
chími
pásas ."
s.trans: And she told him, "Do dress up!"

s.txt:
xás
u chímiha .
s.trans: So he agreed.

s.txt:
ithéekxaram
u vakíriihva .
s.trans: He danced in front all night.

s.txt:
káan
t óo
mah ,
patapriha 'ifápiit .
s.trans: The patapríhak girl saw him there.

s.txt:
xás
p oo súpaaha ,
tá
kun pávyiihship .
s.trans: And when it was day, they left.

s.txt:
xás
tá
kun ip vitshúr oo .
s.trans: And they paddled away again.

s.txt:
vúra
koovúra
tá
kun pávyiihship .
s.trans: They all left.

s.txt:
xás
yáas
u xus , "
chími
naa
káru
kan íp viitshun ."
s.trans: So then he thought, "Let me paddle away again too!"

s.txt:
xás
u píshunvarishuk ,
pa mú paah .
s.trans: So he took his boat out of hiding.

s.txt:
xás
pa mú paah ak
t óo
p váramnih .
s.trans: And he got in his boat.

s.txt:
víri
kún
mu mâam
áxak
ifápiit sha
kun irúfak .
s.trans: There uphill from him two young women came down.

s.txt: kun 'átivu tih .
s.trans: They were carrying burden baskets.

s.txt:
xás
kun ipéer , "
xâatik
nu pkôokanpa ."
s.trans: And they said to him, "Let us go back with you."

s.txt:
xás
u piip , "
pûu ,
naa
vúra
pa naní paa
nîinamich ,
hôoy
íf
nu yâah eesh .
s.trans: And he said, "No, my boat is little, we won't fit.
s.note: In the published text, puu is written with rising accent, but we write that in the current orthography with falling circumflex.

s.txt:
xáy
nu táapxuv ."
s.trans: And they said, "We won't capsize."

s.txt:
xás
kun piip , "
pu kín taapxuv eesh ara ."
s.trans: And they said, "We won't capsize."

s.txt:
xás
kun 'iru váramnih .
s.trans: Then they got in.

s.txt:
xás
vaa
kích
kun ipí tih , "
pu kín taapxuv eesh ara ."
s.trans: And they said only that, "We won't capsize."

s.txt:
pa mukún tiik
ishvít
kóo
aas
kun 'áak kurih tih ,
pa kun 'axaychákishrih tih .
s.trans: They put their hands halfway into the water, when they took hold of (the gunwales).
s.note: The length dot is missing from the long aa in kun'áakurihtih in the published text, though a blank space is there where the dot is supposed to be. The vowel should be long because -kurih triggers potential lengthening.

s.txt:
kun pakúriihvu tih , "
xáyfaat
nu táapxuv ."
s.trans: They were singing, "Let us not capsize!"

s.txt:
xás
kun íp viitroov .
s.trans: So they paddled back upriver.

s.txt:
yíiv
tá
kun íp viitma .
s.trans: They paddled back a long ways.

s.txt:
káruk
kun ítroovu tih .
s.trans: And they looked upriver.

s.txt:
víri
kún
tá
kun p áchak roov
pa mukún paah .
s.trans: There were (the others') boats floating upriver in a bunch.

s.txt:
xás
kun ip vít ruuprin .
s.trans: Then (the others) paddled through (the barrier).
s.note: The long uu in -ruuprin is unexpected. Maybe -ruuprin is the plural action allomorph of -ruprin.

s.txt:
xás
vúrava
u viitróov .
s.trans: So he paddled upriver like that.

s.txt:
xás
pa káan
kun víitma ,
u sívshaapsur
pa 'íshaha .
s.trans: And when they paddled to there, the water opened.

s.txt:
xás
kun íp viitruprih va .
s.trans: And they paddled through.

s.txt:
xás
kun ítroovu tih .
s.trans: Then they looked upriver.

s.txt:
káruk
tá
kun vitíshriih v aheen .
s.trans: (The others) had beached their boats upriver.

s.txt:
tá
kun pávyiihma .
s.trans: They had got back.

s.txt:
yáas
ú p viitmu tih ,
uum
káru .
s.trans: Then he paddled back there too.

s.txt:
xás
pa kun ip vítish
u piip , "
naa
vúra
ni p íkvaatsipree vish ,
pa naní paah ."
s.trans: And when he had beached his boat again, he said, "I'll pick up my boat."

s.txt:
xás
u p íkvaatsip ,
xás
kun pá vyiihroov .
s.trans: And he picked it up, and they went upriver.

s.txt:
xás
pa mu sâam
kun pávyiihma .
s.trans: And they arrived downhill from his house.

s.txt:
káan
xás
pa mú paa
ú p thiivkurih .
s.trans: And he put the boat back in the water there.

s.txt:
xás
kun ipéer , "
sáhyuux
iktávan ."
s.trans: And (the women) told him, "Go get sand!"

s.txt:
xás
u ktávar
pa sáhyuux .
s.trans: So he went and got sand.

s.txt:
káan
u yvéesh ,
pa kun 'íin irak ,
pa 'asiktávaan .
s.trans: He poured it there where the women were.

s.txt:
xás
kun ipéer , "
chími
iktîit i
pa nanu 'átimnam ."
s.trans: And they told him, "Unpack our burden baskets!"

s.txt:
xás
pa kóo
kuma 'arará 'uup ,
pa kun 'ativú tiih va ,
pa kóo
kum éemyaat .
s.trans: And what they were carrying was every kind of Indian treasure, every kind of fur.

s.txt:
káru
pa mu krívraam
u pikchákiroopithva ,
pa sípnuuk
axyará va .
s.trans: And they were lined up around (the inside of) his house, the storage baskets were all full.

s.txt:
pufíchtaahkoo ,
ípmiif
káru
pa kóo
kumá 'uup
p oo tháthriinaa ,
pa sipnúuk ak .
s.trans: White deerskins, black deerskins, and every kind of treasure sat in the storage baskets.

s.txt:
itaharatápas
pa mu sípnuuk ,
p oo pikchákiroopithva .
s.trans: There were a whole lot of storage baskets lined up around.

s.txt:
xás
kun ipéer , "
hári va
p ee máh aak '
pa sáhyuux
aas
kích '
i xús eesh , '
tá
kun piyâaram aheen .'"
s.trans: And they told him, "Whenever you see that the sand is wet, you will know that we've gone again."

s.txt:
tá
xára
vúra
tá
kun 'iin .
s.trans: They lived (there) a long time.

s.txt:
hínu páy
kun imuskír anik ,
p oo p vakirîihvu tih .
s.trans: They had admired him, when he was dancing in front.
s.note: In the published text, the subordinate verb is written popvakirîihvutih, with an unexplainable short o. I have made the o long because a + u -> oo is such a general rule it seems like the short o must be a typo.

s.txt:
xás
vúra
tá
mu hrôoh as .
s.trans: So they were his wives now.

s.txt:
xás
mah'íitnihach
uum
vúrava
u kvatan k ôo tih .
s.trans: So he always went early in the morning to gather sweathouse wood.
s.note: Is the sequence -koo -ku + -oo or -ku + -va? Normally I link it to the entry for -koo, which lists the -ku + -va derivation, but in this sentence there is no other indication of the "always" in the English, so I linked it to the habitual.

s.txt:
xás
u 'íipma .
s.trans: And (one time) he came back.

s.txt:
víri
kún
tá
kun piyâaram aheen .
s.trans: There they had gone away again.

s.txt:
xás
u xus , "
tîi
kan 'ixupsúr oo ,
pa sípnuuk ."
s.trans: And he thought, "Let me uncover the storage baskets!"
s.note: The sentence number is missing in the English in the published text.

s.txt:
víri
kún
axyará va ,
pa kóo
kuma 'arará 'uup .
s.trans: There they were all full, there was all kinds of Indian treasure.

s.txt:
xás
u xus , "
chími
pa naní vaas
kan íkyav ."
s.trans: And he thought, "Let me make my blanket!"

s.txt:
xás
furáx vaas
ú kyav ,
káru
furax yukúku
káru
furax vánakaar .
s.trans: So he made a woodpecker-head blanket, and woodpecker-head shoes and a woodpecker-head vánakaar (a shirtlike garment).

s.txt:
xás
u xus , "
tîi
ithyáruk
patapríha 'ifápiit
kan imúsan ."
s.trans: And he thought, "Let me go across river to see the patapríhak girl!"

s.txt:
xás
u víitkar .
s.trans: So he rowed across.

s.txt:
xás
ú kfuukraa .
s.trans: And he climbed uphill.

s.txt:
p óo 'uum ,
chanchaaksúr ak
p oo tfúnuk va ,
pa mukun 'iinâak
vúra
uum
ú m'aax varayva .
s.trans: When he arrived, when he looked inside through the smokehole, it was red all over inside their house (by reflection from his clothing).

s.txt:
xás
pa kéevniikich
u piip , "
kóku ,
yáxa
hûut
t u 'iin ,
pa nunu krívraam .
s.trans: And the old woman said, "Oh-oh, look, what's wrong with our house?

s.txt:
t óo
m'aax varayva ."
s.trans: It's red all over."

s.txt:
vúra
vaa
ú muus tih .
s.trans: He was looking at them.

s.txt:
vuraakira 'ípan
u kûuntakiishrih .
s.trans: He sat down on top of the ladder.

s.txt:
pa mukun 'ikrívraam
vúra
t óo
m'aax varayva .
s.trans: Their house was red all over.

s.txt:
vúra
furax múrax
pa mú saanva .
s.trans: His clothes were nothing but woodpecker-heads.

s.txt:
xás
p oo tfúnuk va ,
u mah ,
káan
ú krii ,
pa 'ifápiit .
s.trans: And when he looked inside, he saw her, the girl was there.

s.txt:
axíich
t óo
thiiná tih .
s.trans: She had a child.

s.txt:
káruma
aván hiipux .
s.trans: (But) the fact was, she was without a husband.
s.note: Interestingly, Bright gives aváriipux as the word for "without a husband" in 621.7. Bright says that -hiipux should only appear after stems ending in the morphophoneme A.

s.txt:
káru
mit
kun vîihi tih at ,
pá mit
u musan kôo tih at .
s.trans: And they had disliked him, when he had gone to see her.

s.txt:
xás
p óo muus tih ,
pa kéevniikich
vúra
t u píkshar ,
káru
pa 'ifápiit
vúra
t u píkshar .
s.trans: And as he watched, the old woman just melted, and the girl just melted.

s.txt:
kóova
tá
kun 'aháraam ,
pá t u 'uum .
s.trans: They were so ashamed when he arrived.

s.txt:
vúra
furax múrax
pa mú saanva .
s.trans: His clothes were nothing but woodpecker-heads.

s.txt:
vúra
vaa
ú muus tih vunaa tih .
s.trans: He was looking at them like that.
s.note: See pg. 114 in Bright for discussion of verbs with two -tih suffixes.

s.txt:
vákay
kích
kun ikrítuv .
s.trans: Only worms lay there.

s.txt:
xás
u pvâaram .
s.trans: Then he went back home.

s.txt:
ú p viitkar ,
itukuk 'afishríhan .
s.trans: The boy from itúkuk rowed back across.

s.txt:
vaa
u kúphaa nik ,
itukuk 'afishríhan .
s.trans: The boy from itúkuk did that.
